author: Colin Bowles
title: Concord Falls on the Road
text:
Concord Falls on the Road - WVVA TV Bluefield Beckley WV News, Weather and Sports Member Center: Concord Falls on the Road Posted: Follow @ColinxBowles SOUTH EUCLID, OH (WVVA) - 
Calvinaugh Jones broke Concord's all-time career rushing record Saturday afternoon, but his 139 yards and rushing score weren't enough as the Concord University fell to Notre Dame, 23-21. 
Notre Dame jumped out to a 17-0 lead in the first half, however, Concord fought back in the second half as Jones found the end zone for the 11th time this season to cap a seven play, 76-yard drive to begin the second half and cut the deficit to 17-7. 
Brian Novak finished the game 17-for-27 for 212 yards passing and one interception. T.J. Smith had his first 100-yard receiving game of 2015 as he hauled in five passes for 110 yards.Senior defensive end Ervin Moore notched a career-high 12 tackles and also forced a career-best two fumbles on the day. Meanwhile, senior linebacker Austin Dotson recorded 10 tackles, a season-best. 
Concord returns home Saturday to take on nationally-ranked Shepherd at noon.
